name: Confederation of European Paper Industries
goal:
The Confederation of European Paper Industries AISBL (abbreviated as CEPI) is an international non-profit association, incorporated under the laws of Belgium.

The purpose of the association, to the exclusion of any profit-making intent, is to study the economic, technical, statistical and environmental developments of the European pulp, paper or cardboard industry, to promote co-operation among European organizations of producers of pulp, paper or cardboard in this regard, and to advance research and implementation of solutions relating thereto.

Through its 18 member countries (17 European Union members plus Norway) CEPI represents approximately 515 pulp, paper and board producing companies across Europe, ranging from small and mediumsized companies to multi-nationals, and more than 950 paper mills. Together they represent 23% of the global pulp and paper production.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Food Safety, Information Society, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trade, Transport
